name: Classic Roasted Beet Salad with Goat Cheese and Walnuts
ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, plus more for drizzling
1/2 cup walnuts, toasted and roughly chopped
instructions: Wash and scrub the beets, trim off the tops and roots.
Wrap each beet individually in aluminum foil. Place on a baking sheet.
Roast for 45-60 minutes, or until a fork easily pierces the center of the beets. Cooking time depends on the size of the beets.
Let the beets cool slightly before handling. When cool enough to handle, rub the skins off with a paper towel or your hands.
Cut the beets into bite-sized wedges or cubes.
In a small bowl, whisk together balsamic vinegar, Dijon mustard, honey, minced garlic, 2 tablespoons olive oil, salt, and pepper.
In a large bowl, toss the mixed greens with a light drizzle of olive oil and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Arrange the greens on a platter or individual plates. Top with the roasted beets, crumbled goat cheese, and toasted walnuts.
Drizzle the balsamic vinaigrette over the salad. Serve immediately.
